io.jeo.util

Class Password

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.jeo.util.Password

  • public class Password
extends Object
    Utility class for handling passwords.

    This class stores passwords internally in a character array and not a String. After the application is done with the password it should call dispose() in order to scramble the password to help prevent "heap dump" attacks.

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

    • Constructor Detail

      • Password

        public Password(char[] passwd)

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public static String toString(Password passwd)
        Returns the password contents as a string.

        Note that this method defeats the purpose of this class since it returns a string which will then be stored and pooled in memory. Secure applications should avoid using this method and use get() if possible.

      • create

        public static Password create(String passwd)
        Creates a new password from a string.

        Note that this method defeats the purpose of this class since it requires a string, which will be pooled in memory. Secure applications should use the constructor of this class if possible.

      • get

        public char[] get()

      • matches

        public boolean matches(String text)
        Tests the password against the specified string.
        Returns:
        True if the text matches this password.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(char[] text)
        Tests the password against the specified character array.
        Returns:
        True if the text matches this password.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes and scrambling the password.
